p: The use of herbs and spices dates back to 5000 B.C. Therefore, they might be considered one of the first functional foods. Experimental evidence supports the health benefits attributed to spices and herbs, for example, cardio-protective and anti-atherogenic potential, digestive stimulant action, antidiabetic effects, antilithogenic properties, cancer-preventive potential and anti-inflammatory properties [ 83, 84, 85].
